intro: Scabiosa tschiliensis var. japonica, commonly known as Japanese scabious, is a flowering plant native to Japan. It belongs to the Caprifoliaceae family and is characterized by its clusters of pink or white flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and has finely divided, fern-like leaves. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for garden landscapes. The flowers attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies, contributing to its ecological value.
